intro: Cousinia pterolepida, commonly known as the woolly cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Cousinia pterolepida is a perennial herb that produces small yellow flowers, which bloom in the summer months.
